886064859:
[

Senior Technical Recruiter

Company Name IMC Trading Company Location Sydney, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 7 hours ago Number of views 19 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Are you passionate about challenging the status quo? Are you driven by your curiosity and desire to learn? Do you thrive on problem solving, a process where you recognise opportunity for improvement then iterate and innovate to make it happen?


RECRUITING AT IMC:


  • Responsible for innovative sourcing strategies to find top technical talent. Full lifecycle recruiting includes, setting sourcing strategy, mapping and headhunting talent, reviewing resumes, crafting the selection process, interviewing candidates, and managing the offer and sell process.
  • Build, manage, and strengthen relationships with external recruiting agencies
  • Use data to drive decision making in process. Provide consistent reporting on recruiting activity and metrics.
  • Stay “ahead of the curve” on emerging trends in the market and the latest creative recruiting channels particularly among IMC’s competitors for talent in trading and technology. Play an active role in the branding and marketing of the IMC brand.
  • Represent the IMC brand externally to top talent and convey our unique opportunities and company culture.


WHAT MAKES IT FUN?


  • At IMC, you’ll be a true partner to our hiring managers and an integral part of building the technical teams and growing our business.
  • Drive decision-making in the Recruitment space by using data and analytics to inform our process and hiring strategies.
  • Push the boundaries of talent acquisition. You will have the ability to bring creative ideas to the table and the support to make an impact.
  • Collaborate across the globe and partner closely with the recruitment teams in Europe and APAC to learn and share best practices from the Chicago market beyond.
  • Be a part of the IMC team. We rely on each and every person to help us meet our organizational goals. Your hard work and dedication matters and will be recognized.


YOU HAVE:


  • 5+ years of technical recruiting experience in a fast-paced and dynamic industry (technology, financial services, start up, etc)
  • Direct sourcing skillset – the ability to identify and source passive candidates via linkedin, talent communities, referrals, etc.
  • Excellent academic credentials; Bachelor’s degree from a top tier university preferred.
  • Experience recruiting professionals at all levels and adjusting approach to fit different levels or types of candidates
  • Experience working with organizations known for their forward-thinking talent practices and high bar for talent.
  • Career history that demonstrates loyalty and tenure coupled with continued growth and success (increased complexity and responsibility in roles)
  • Effective communication and follow through to meet the expectations of multiple stakeholders
  • Energy and passion combined with poise and sound judgement to establish credibility and earn the respect of professionals in the firm.
  • Strong self-motivation and multi-tasking skills. This role will require effectively setting (and resetting) priorities. Flexibility and resilience is key to pivot as priorities change.
  • Mental agility to adapt to our dynamic environment and business.


OUR CULTURE:


Globally, we believe in hiring the best people and giving them the freedom, responsibility and ongoing support they need to succeed (and have some fun along the way). They learn, grow and expand their knowledge in a flat structure that means the best ideas are always recognized, regardless of position. From traders, to technologists, to our business support team, it’s their collaboration that is one of our biggest strengths, and has made us one of the world’s leading market makers.

We have a great opportunity for a Road Worker – Asphalt to join our Works team to undertake a range of tasks related to infrastructure maintenance, civil construction works and associated activities for the City of Greater Bendigo.

884742653:
[

Marketing Manager - Life Insurance

Company Name HCF Australia Company Location 403 George Street, Sydney, NSW 2000, AU

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 27 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About the role

This role exists to create and deliver the strategy for all Life Insurance marketing and customer communication activity. Primary responsibilities include campaign development and customer life-cycle management. This role collaborates closely with our Marketing and Data Analytics teams for the successful development and implementation of Life Insurance initiatives.

You will develop a clearly articulated acquisition and customer marketing strategy that identifies priority customer segments and relevant fit of Life products; and compelling value propositions for target segments, contemplating holistic PHI and Life propositions. You will engage with the broader HCF Marketing teams to leverage and apply segment insights to Life insurance activity. Similarly, you will collaborate with the Product team on the design and pricing of products to deliver customer propositions.

You will build the annual marketing plan and campaign calendar; including new-to-HCF, cross-sell and up-sell initiatives; to deliver on acquisition and retention targets. You will develop and execute a lead generation roadmap in conjunction with the Advertising & Campaigns team; as well as develop and deliver compelling customer communications with the Member Marketing and Communications team.

In terms of Retention and Life-cycle Management, you will own and drive the Life annual notice communications program; monitor the lapse performance of the Life insurance portfolio and implement strategies to reduce customer attrition; develop and deploy initiatives that provide opportunities for customers to upgrade and review their cover; and work with the PHI teams to understand life-cycle opportunities across Life and Health portfolios.

Finally, in terms of Customer Experience Management, you will develop a strong understanding of key customer touch points and optimise customer interactions through the use of digital channels. You will review the Life insurance customer communications suite to ensure all touch points are consistent and deliver an exceptional customer experience.


About you


  • Life Insurance marketing/strategy experience
  • 5+ years in a direct response marketing role
  • Tertiary qualifications in marketing, business, communications or similar
  • Strong communicator and influencer with the ability to work in a matrix environment
  • Effective stakeholder engagement and management skills
  • Well-developed project management skills
  • Excellent written communications skills with the ability to develop and review compelling copy
  • Demonstrated experience in:
    • delivering business outcomes from the application of strategic insights
    • developing effective data-driven below-the-line campaigns
    • digital campaign delivery, including lead generation

884928303:
[

AppleCare Senior Specialist - Australia AHA

Company Name Apple Company Location Sydney, AU

New Posted Date Posted 1 hour ago

Be an early applicant

Job description

You're a problem solver and easily connect with customers! You exceed their expectations with your guidance, knowledge, and real passion for technology. You’re enamored by the way things operate, and have the ability to figure out how technology works when things go wrong. You have excellent verbal and written communication skills, as well as the ability to effectively prioritize and manage your time. You can multitask across systems and applications, analyze, isolate and resolve a variety of complex issues, and comfortably navigate a technical environment. You effortlessly engage, explaining step by step solutions with patience and an approach tailored to each individual customer. You’re not only here to help fix technical issues, but also provide an incredible customer experience.
AppleCare Senior Specialists are responsible for providing daily leadership and promoting the development of the AppleCare customer support repair team. You are a customer-focused person who is self-motivated, friendly and has a passion to develop people and solve customer issues in an efficient and effective manner. Because you’ll work independently from home, you’ll need the discipline and ability to work remotely from coworkers and management. If this sounds like you, you could be the next AppleCare At Home Senior Specialist. We’re committed to helping employees explore their potential.
This is an at home position and you can live in any city across Australia. You do not need to live in the city that is posted in to be considered.

Description

We expect everything from an Advisor that our customers do and we want Apple to be a reflection of the world around us. As an AppleCare Advisor, you’ll be supporting many of our popular products, from iPhones to iPads to MacBooks to desktop Macs. As our customers’ point of contact, you’ll be the friendly voice of Apple, providing world-class customer service, troubleshooting, and technical support. We’ll rely on you to listen to our customers and use your technical expertise, creativity, and passion to meet their needs — and remind them that behind our great products are amazing people. Because we believe our individual backgrounds, perspectives, and passions help us create the ideas that move all of us forward. We’ll train you to be the best.
As an AppleCare Senior Specialist, you’ll be part of a team of specialists who depend on each other and share responsibility for the management of multiple email, chat, phone, and administrative deliverable queues. You’ll manage performance and develop Advisors through one-on-ones, check-ins, contact evaluations, and feedback. You’ll provide support options, total resolution, and solutions to Apple customers and your team. Your correspondence will focus on resolving complex customer service and repair issues. You’ll work under tight timelines, and be responsible for communicating official positioning on issues and developing creative solutions to complex customer problems. You’ll identify emerging product or customer dissatisfaction issues and opportunities for operational improvements and strategies. You are empowered to use judgment when balancing company and customer needs and interacting with customers prior to and/or after repair. You’ll develop and maintain positive customer relations while coordinating with various functions within the repair department to ensure customer requests are handled appropriately and in a timely manner. You’ll have authority to substantially affect the relationship between Apple and its customers, either from a financial standpoint or product standpoint.
This position comes with competitive pay, great benefits, eligibility to participate in our company stock plan, time off, an employee discount, and dedicated resources to support your ongoing growth and career development.
Education Details
AA/AS degree or higher, or equivalent experience

Key Qualifications
  • Minimum 2 years experience in customer service or technical support
  • Knowledge of contact center management tools, processes, procedures, and performance metrics, with ability to innovate and improve as needed
  • Passion for customer service and ownership of the customer experience including comprehensive issue resolution
  • Aptitude for acquiring advanced technical skills and an eagerness to learn and take on new challenges
  • Able to effectively tailor communication and style to differing audiences
  • Able to self manage and work independently in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment
  • Thrives on a team where expertise is shared and feedback is welcomed
  • Effective time management including ability to multi-task, organize and prioritize
  • Solution oriented leader with advanced judgment, negotiation and problem solving skills that establishes relationships and seeks to understand what motivates individuals
  • Experience developing employees to achieve excellent customer service results with coaching plans that incorporate observations, key performance trends and technical concepts
  • Experience using technology to create team cohesiveness and establish rapport
  • Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action
  • Leads a standard for high-quality work by consistently meeting and exceeding performance goals
Additional Requirements

Additional Requirements
  • Available to attend approximately 5-6 weeks of required training on a fixed schedule that may include weekends
  • Successful completion of a pre-employment assessment and background check
  • Successful completion of initial training
  • Able to meet minimum typing speed of 40 WPM while talking with customers
At Home Requirements
  • A quiet workspace, ergonomic chair, and desk
  • High-speed Internet service (5 megabits download and 1 megabit upload) from a reliable provider.
Additional Information

Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants.

Job description

Permanent full time opportunity at our St Leonards location


About the role

AMP Assist is our direct to customer channel and compromises a number of functions; personal advice, scoped and ongoing, general advice, sales, retention, outbound campaigns and customer webchat.

The purpose of this role is to manage and lead a team of phone- based consultants in the implementation, compliance, delivery and support of AMP’s operational growth and retention strategy and other direct to customer initiatives.


Key responsibilities:\xa0
* Lead a team of AMP Assist concierge consultants with a variety of roles whilst supporting growth, tactical improvement initiatives and retention of the AMP Assist client base.
* Provide leadership, coaching and direction to AMP Assist concierge consultants.
*\xa0Be responsible for supporting the AMP Financial Planning practice with the ongoing service needs of customers within the AMP Corporate plans, triage of customer pool clients that have been identified as having an advice or education requirement, and the support of customers that have been transitioned to AMP Assist practice.


Skills & experience:
* Demonstrated customer and operational service orientation, with the ability to build relationships with key stakeholders, provide insights and feedback to the broader business and be proactive in delivering the desired business outcomes
*\xa0Demonstrated leadership experience with the ability to coach, motivate, and influence team members in a fast paced environment
*\xa0A sound understanding of financial planning industry, and Personal Advice experience
*\xa0Diploma of Financial Planning and RG146


Working for AMP


Working for AMP means being part of a company that values diverse thinking, encourages collaboration and promotes innovation. \xa0It’s an environment that offers challenging and exciting work as well as opportunities for professional growth. We’re flexible enough to allow you to make the most of your life, both professionally and personally.



We are looking for those that have the courage and agility to navigate changing and complex environments so that we can deliver the best solutions for our customers. We value people with integrity, an innate willingness to help others and an eagerness to perform to the best of their abilities.\xa0


We’re transforming our business, and we need people like you to join us on this journey.


Wellbeing & Benefits


As a company that values wellbeing, we offer a range of great benefits to support you financially, professionally and personally. These include access to a wide range of flexible working options including the ability to purchase extra leave, retail discounts, onsite wellbeing centre including a gym (Sydney Office), Employee Assistance Program, competitive home loan rates, leading superannuation contribution, discounted financial advice and personal insurance


Inclusion & Diversity


AMP recognises individual differences and welcomes people from a variety of life and work experiences. The diversity of our people is core to our ability to innovate, grow and to fulfill our collective aspiration of helping people to own their tomorrow. A natural curiosity, a respect for differences and a growth mindset are valued at AMP

[

Business Analyst (Maternity Cover)

Company Name Helloworld Travel Limited Company Location Mascot, New South Wales, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 4 hours ago Number of views 28 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Helloworld Travel Limited needs your expertise as a Business Analyst\xa0to work with our Business Systems and Applications team on a 12 month (maternity cover) contract.

We have a fantastic opportunity for a Business Analyst to join Helloworld Travel Limited, one of Australia’s leading integrated travel business.


The Business Analyst will work within our team in Mascot, which forms a part of the wider Wholesale Business Systems and Application team. \xa0


As a Business Analyst you will be responsible for understanding, analysing, documenting and communicating functional and technical specifications, with particular focus on the Calypso Travel System suite of applications. As the subject matter expert of your project, you will be responsible for gathering information from relevant stakeholders and developing process maps of the requirements which can then be communicated internal and external development teams.


\xa0

Your responsibility will include:

  • Application developments for Wholesale systems with a focus on Calypso;
  • Liaising with the Calypso User Group to ensure that proposed solutions are optimal;
  • Analysing, designing, implementing and supporting new and revised processes;
  • Liaising with Business Systems management to maximise and achieve full potential of Wholesale systems;
  • Conducting analysis of workflow with operational areas of Wholesale to assist in process improvement;
  • Liaising with internal and external development teams to analyse, test and implement system enhancements and bug fixes;
  • Advising users on efficient system use, and train them as necessary;
  • Formulating, designing and producing training support documentation, clue cards and reference manuals where required; and
  • Assisting in the evaluation of trends in computer and communications applications to identify new business opportunities


To be successful in this role you will have:

  • Previous experience in a similar role that included requirements gathering, system design, testing, training and implementation support;
  • Demonstrated previous experience of working with Travel systems, specifically the Calypso Travel System;
  • Proven analytical skills with the ability to learn quickly;
  • Experience building strong working relationships with business sponsors, key stakeholders and subject matter experts across the business;
  • Strong communication skills;
  • Ability to adapt to different and rapidly changing business & technological environments;
  • Ability to rapidly understand issues and facilitate resolution; and
  • Experience working on complex projects

\xa0

\xa0


If you are interested in applying for this role, please send your resume by close of business 09 October 2018.


To be eligible to apply for this position, applicants must have existing Australian work rights.\xa0 Only short listed candidates will be contacted and may be required to complete an Australian Federal Police background check.


Recruitment Agencies - thank you for thinking of us, however we do endeavour to fill our opportunities through direct channels wherever possible.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Ability to travel locally, interstate and internationally as required

\xa0

What you will do in this role:

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Responsible for evangelising the HP workstation range to our reseller base

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Drive Product and Programs to enable sales team and channel partners in driving HP WS and MWS portfolio

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Development of brand advocates across the business, selected Champions across states, ultimately brand advocates within their own business and in channel

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Align with HP and distributor Commercial PC strategy at all times - continual alignment on quarterly and greater strategic planning with HP team

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Provide customer service and sales support to all Dicker Data resellers when required

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Develop strong product and process knowledge of HP Workstation product

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Establish and grow relationships with resellers across key workstation verticals such as: (Manufacturing, Mining, Finance, Graphic Design etc.)

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Forecast accurately throughout the month and quarter

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Ensure that, where possible, the customer's financial arrangements are in line with their business needs (credit limits, payment terms etc.). Initiate reviews as appropriate

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Proactively distribute HP Workstation product information and pricing to customers, such as product releases, special promotions, product updates and marketing activities

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Proactively seek and develop new business opportunities in existing and potential accounts

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Co-ordinate and conduct presentations to customers in order to provide HP Workstation product or technology information along with information about the Dicker Data value proposition

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Involved in quarterly vendor reviews with relevant Dicker Data and vendor personnel

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Prepare quarterly marketing plans for HP workstations that ensure all Dicker Data and vendor objectives are met

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Meet with HP on a regular basis – review any issues, opportunities and plans

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Prepare a business plan for HP Workstations and review regularly to assess progress

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Responsible for managing workstation inventory to ensure the correct stock is ordered and the correct quantities maintained

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Ensure there is the right mix of stock available

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Manage stock over 90 days – work with vendor to receive RMA numbers for Faulty, Discontinued and Stock Balancing rotations

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Work with vendors to move non selling items and negotiate for exception returns where necessary

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Work with all Dicker Data management to identify and optimise any opportunities and to prevent or resolve any product-related issues

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Communicate HP workstation promotions, initiatives, training, and operational changes to all departments

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Overall, ensure the optimum sales and streamlined management of the entire HP workstation product range within responsibility

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Set base margins for each product line

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Review pricing structure and margins to maintain competitive pricing on a regular basis

\xa0

Your rewards in this role:

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 A highly competitive salary package depending upon experience

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 A positive family centric culture and long-standing record of gender equality and diversity.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Convenient on-site parking

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Staff only on-site gym & weekly corporate yoga classes

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 A selection of freshly prepared lunch options provided daily

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 On-site ergonomics consultant

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 A relaxed, modern office setting with smart casual dress

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Discounted health insurance options

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Access to comprehensive discounted superannuation products and insurance

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Various banking and finance benefits

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Travel and lifestyle benefits

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 A professional environment comprised of driven yet supportive teams

Job description

QinetiQ comprises teams of dedicated people; experts in defence, aerospace, security and related markets. We draw on our extensive technical knowledge and intellectual property to provide the know-how and support to solve some of the world’s most challenging problems. Our people make the critical difference to customers by providing unique approaches to problem solving. Why don’t you join some of the world’s finest scientific and technical minds and help us make tomorrow work today?

Job Description

 Job description/Person specification Data Analyst/Media Reader (GG7)

The job holder will work in the Trials Solutions and Data Analysis group within Analysis Modelling and Simulation. The main purpose of the post is providing accurate and timely results in support of trials for military systems.

The Job Holder Is Expected, With Training, To Cover
  • Accurate assessment of instrumentation records
  • Operation and use of media reading workstation for both manual and automatic modes
  • Extraction of measurements and fragments from witness cards using semi automatic systems. Some manual handling is required.
  • Manipulation of files, data merging, logging and data processing
  • Checking of data files and customer results from completeness and accuracy
  • Production of output reports in an electronic format
  • Fault reporting and statistics.
  • Encryption of data using standard tools.
  • Ensure compliance with QinetiQ policies (including HS&E) and adhere to behavioural expectations at all times.
Knowledge, Skills, And Personal Qualities Required
  • Good interpersonal, analytical space/time problem solving.
  • The ability to learn quickly to develop domain knowledge appropriate to the tasks required and to work without supervision.
  • Team player who can also use their initiative
  • Adaptability and Methodical
  • Good written and oral communication skills
  • The applicant will be expected to prepare technical documentation and e-reports.
Challenges
  • Adaptability and flexibility
  • Learn technical procedures, process and techniques quickly in order to become a deployable asset within the group.
Key Accountabilities
  • Handling of secure data and IDO material (clearance up to secret)
  • Deliver tasks to time, quality and cost as directed by the appropriate project manager, Team Leader or technical lead.
Essential Qualifications
  • A minimum of 5 GCSE passes at Grade C or above are essential, to include the following: Mathematics, English, and ICT. These are to support the numerical nature of the role and the technical e-reports produced.
  • A suitable recognised engineering or science related qualification (HNC, NVQ Level 4, Degree, etc) is an advantage.
Other information and
  • Security Clearance required to Secret.
  • The successful applicant is expected to demonstrate objectivity, impartiality, detachment, and integrity in delivering his contribution to QinetiQ’s vision.

Why join ANSTO?


ANSTO employees are passionate about what they do. We enjoy being part of an organisation making a difference in the lives of Australians.


We support and reward our employees through eligibility for:


  • Training, development and mentoring opportunities

  • Performance based salary increases

  • Work-life balance with generous leave entitlements and flexible conditions


Located in the Sutherland Shire, we have free onsite parking, a swimming pool, health and wellbeing programs and an onsite caf\xe9.



About the position


The GMP Process / Project Engineer is employed and supported by the Engineering and Capital Programs (E&CP) division which is responsible for the provision of engineering services to ANSTO Health. \xa0This position is responsible for delivering engineering solutions including designing, implementing and managing efficient, safe and compliant production processes and facilities to meet the business requirements of ANSTO Health. This position operates within a well-defined project discipline and involves a range of multidisciplinary stakeholders at various levels across ANSTO Health - Production, Supply Chain and Quality groups, the Engineering and Capital Programs division and the Asset Management and Services Group.

This role reports to the E&CP/Engineering Delivery Office’s Customer Advocacy and Value Chain (CAVC) Portfolio Leader and will be fully deployed into ANSTO Health. \xa0Along with other members of the deployed engineering team and members of AM&SG and ANSTO Health this role is responsible for the reliability and availability of ANSTO Health’s radio-isotope manufacturing plants and its associated systems and ensures ongoing compliance with regulatory and statutory requirements.


\xa0

“We are looking for a suitably qualified engineer with a genuine interest in assisting with reliable availability of radiopharmaceutical products. ”


-\xa0Gerard Breen,\xa0Acting E&CP Portfolio Leader CAVC



Duties and responsibilities


          • Develop and design process and mechanical improvements for radiopharmaceutical production compliant with regulatory requirements.
          • Ensure compliance to GMP is maintained, through an understanding of clean room and equipment regulatory requirements.

          • Lead the manufacturing, testing, commissioning and validation of equipment.

\xa0

    • Degree qualification in Chemical/Process or Pharmaceutical Engineering,

    • Understanding of Pharmaceutical quality systems, GMP and principles of validation.

    • Knowledge of chemical processing technologies related to nuclear, pharmaceutical, biotech and related industries.

Job description

About Us
\xa0
Nine’s strategy is to create great content, distribute it broadly and engage audiences and advertisers. As the home of some of Australia’s most trusted and loved brands spanning News, Lifestyle, Entertainment, and Sport, we pride ourselves on creating the best content, accessed by consumers when and how they want it to ensure they are entertained, informed and connected each and every day.
Our business operates in the following 4 divisions – FTA Television, Digital Publishing, Video on Demand (advertising and subscription) and Content Production.
\xa0
\xa0
The Role
\xa0
Nine is looking for a talented Media Research Analyst to help drive insights for our leading digital brands nine.com.au, 9News, Wide World of Sports, 9Now, and 9Honey.
Reporting to the Digital Media Research Manager, the Media Research Analyst will be responsible for providing reporting, research and insights into the performance of Nine's digital properties. You will support effective data-driven decision making to ensure Nine delivers the best news, entertainment, lifestyle and video on demand products to our users.
Our highly valued Media Research Analysts are key members within a group of media research specialists who provide insights and data analytics support across the business. The team provides timely and insightful research to key stakeholders within the company to assist in the growth of reach & revenue within the competitive digital publishing marketplace. \xa0
As a key member of the team, you will support a wide range of internal departments across the business including Digital Sales, Product, Editorial, Marketing, Data Science, Content Partnerships, Corporate Strategy and Operations.
\xa0
Responsibilities:
\xa0
Reporting to the Digital Research Manager you will be responsible for:

  • Responding effectively and in a timely manner to research requests from the sales team
  • Produce and maintain audience reports and dashboards.
  • Work with the team to proactively develop new sales research presentations and collateral
  • Analyse site traffic and interpreting audience behaviour
  • Provide support for bespoke surveys run by the research team
  • Using research tools such as Nielsen Digital Ratings and Adobe Analytics to provide information to the sales and product teams

Skills & Experience:

  • A passion for Digital or TV media brands
  • Strong analytical skills and the ability to disseminate insights from research and data
  • Strong presentation and written communication skills honed from a university degree or related experience
  • A high level of interpersonal skills and ability to build effective relationships across internal teams

Company Name Nearmap Company Location Barangaroo, New South Wales, Australia

Be an early applicant

Job description

Nearmap is currently providing a virtual model of the real world – at a scale and detail that hasn’t been done before. At Nearmap, we have an appetite for high performing individuals and we are currently on the hunt for a Software Engineer.


A bit more about the culture…

At Nearmap, every opinion matters, our business model partnered with our open-door management style gives you the opportunity to make an impact. Our Nearmappers see the world differently and are intently focused on delivering the best location content in the world. Having a shared goal and a lot of fun reaching it is how our Nearmappers truly flourish at their home away from home. We're all super down-to-earth - except when we're in the sky capturing fresh imagery!


A typical day for you may look like this…

As a Software Engineer, you will work on projects critical to Nearmap’s needs. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. In this role, you will work within our Survey Systems group and be responsible for the visualisation of geospatial data, automated image processing workflows, cloud-based cluster management, large-scale system design, interactive data-visualisation, creative UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day.


The essentials…

  • Strong skills in JavaScript (3+ years experience)
  • 2+ years of full-stack web development experience using modern frameworks
  • 5+ years of experience in software development
  • Demonstrated technical creativity and problem-solving ability
  • Understanding of sound architectural and design practices
  • Good design skills and understanding of what makes an elegant, clean design
  • Ability to write clean, elegant code
  • Interest in doing code reviews
  • Deep passion for software
  • Strong computer science, engineering, or other technical (science/mathematics) degree from a top-tier university
  • Excellent communication skills


Bonus points will be awarded for skills and experience in…

  • Experience with React would be highly regarded
  • Experience with GIS/mapping applications
  • Experience with 2D and/or 3D visualization
  • Awareness of mathematics relevant to computer graphics/visualization (trigonometry, linear algebra)
  • Cloud infrastructure (especially AWS)
  • Requirements gathering from a diverse set of internal/external stakeholders
  • Proficiency in C++ would be an unexpected bonus
  • UI experience using the Qt framework


Some of our perks include…

  • Competitive pay, bonus plan and Employee Share Scheme
  • Flexible working environment, work life balance is a necessity \xa0
  • Opportunities for continued career growth and development
  • Ergonomic workstations with sit stand desks
  • Fortnightly massages
  • Free reign of Nearmap’s products
  • Free healthy breakfast, snacks & lunches available in our kitchen with water views
  • An allowance to help you focus on your well being


If this experience excites you and you are ready to join the Nearmap team, please apply!


Watch our culture video and find out more about what a day in the life at Nearmap looks like:\xa0https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R7rikZqa8n8

Company


This global food company has invested into well established businesses which produce high quality branded food and beverage products for Australian and global markets. The company has established a significant position within the food industry by improving food processing and production methods.


For the last two years, consecutively, the company has been an award holder for the quality of their dairy products. This vertically integrated food company has established several large-scale dairies to ensure quality across the value chain and invested in significant manufacturing facilities. Their goal is to develop high quality, affordable products for the every-day consumer.


Position


Reporting to the Chief Operating Officer, the Business Manager will be responsible for leading and growing the raw milk supply function and overseeing the implementation and management of a fully integrated milk management system. Account Specialist - Hospital

Company Name Nestl\xe9 Company Location Sydney

New Posted Date Posted 7 hours ago Number of views 9 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


Account Specialist - Hospital

Share our passion for nutrition and be valued for your skills.

  • Are you a qualified Dietitian or Speech Pathologist, looking for a new challenge and the opportunity to make a positive difference to patient welfare?
  • Utilize your clinical skills to join a leading Nutrition, Health, and Wellness company
  • Excellent training, support and development opportunities provided to help you succeed

Our Story
Nestl\xe9 Health Science aims to be the market leader in specialised nutrition solutions that enhance consumer health and wellbeing. We provide a range of nutritional products into hospital, aged-care, pharmacy, grocery and route channels.

Your Opportunity
We have an exciting opportunity for a professionally presented, customer and relationships focused individual to join our team as an Account Specialist - Hospital. Reporting to the Field Operations Manager, you will utilize your clinical knowledge to influence and educate healthcare professionals within the hospital space on the use of our credible, scientifically supported product range. With your relationship-management skills, you will influence key decision makers within Hospitals, as you strive to exceed sales targets, and make a difference to patient welfare. Confident and able to engage people from all walks of life, you’ll be at ease developing new business opportunities and bolstering our existing accounts.

Other responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:
  • Implement marketing and sales business strategies and activities of the Hospital sales team to drive products sales and market share growth within assigned territory
  • Accurately maintain all customer account call activity in the Company CRM system (Veeva)
  • Project management of identified projects delegated by the National Sales Manager

About You
To succeed in the role, you will have tertiary qualifications in either Nutrition and Dietetics, Speech Pathology, Health Sciences, or Nursing with 2+ years of clinical experience in Hospital within Healthcare or Pharmaceuticals industry. Experience as a Dietitian or Speech Pathologist will be highly regarded.
You will be responsible to manage Western Australia. Due to the nature of this role it is important that you are comfortable spending time on the road with regular travel – approximately 2-4 regional trips per year. Please note that in order to visit your customers, you must have a current unrestricted driver’s license and be prepared for overnight travel. Please note you will also be required to attend Sales Conferences twice a year, each requiring a 1 week stay.

In return, you’ll enjoy rewards and incentives for your achievements and all the support and training you would expect from a market leader in the Healthcare space.

This is an opportunity to develop your career as part of a global brand, with strong growth product portfolio, while translating your knowledge into the commercial setting and keeping your clinical skills current.

Interested? Apply now and submit your application.

Applicants must be eligible to work in Australia and have permanent residency.

For more information please visit our website @ www.nestle.com.au/careers or Our LinkedIn page https://www.linkedin.com/company/nestl\xe9-health-science

883644135:
[

Practice and Quality Officer. Permanent Full Time,

Company Name Life Without Barriers Company Location Richmond, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 6 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

**About the Organisation**
Life Without Barriers is a leading social purpose, not for profit organisation of 5,600 employees working in more than 440 communities across Australia. We support children, young people and families, people with disability, older people and people with mental illness. We work with people who are homeless and refugees and asylum seekers.
We want to employ people who reflect the diversity of our clients to ensure we can support each client's individual needs and wants. We encourage people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background and people with disability to apply.
**About the role**
The Quality Assurance Officer (QAO) role is a member of the VIC Quality team which is part of the national Practice and Quality business area. The QAO plays a key role in identifying and targeting areas for practice improvement in partnership with Client Services to promote best practice in service delivery. Through coaching, mentoring and support the role will have a critical practice support function which is facilitated through a range of quality assurance and management processes to achieve improved outcomes for LWB clients across a range of programs including Out of Home Care, Disability Services, Mental Health and other child and family services.
  • Key Responsibilities**:
  • Build and maintain positive and professional working relationships with corporate business areas, Client Services and other key stakeholders and partners
  • Develop, implement and monitor continuous improvement plans and other strategies in partnership with Client Services to promote best practice in service delivery
  • Assist in the development of policies, procedures, practice improvements and tools
  • Train, coach, mentor and support Client Services staff to understand and be able to implement policy and procedure requirements into their practice to ensure positive outcomes for clients and meet the required practice standards
  • Provide advice and support to Client Services staff to support the consistent application and implementation of legislation, standards, contracts and LWB policy and procedure requirements
  • Coordinate and undertake internal audits in accordance with the Internal Audit Program
  • Contribute to the process for renewing/gaining accreditation/licensing with the state
  • Undertake root cause analysis to identify opportunities for improvement and practice development
  • Facilitate reflective practice processes with Client Services staff
  • Maintain a current knowledge of changes to legislation, practice standards and customer requirements
  • Keep abreast of best practice and emerging trends and interpretations of legislative/regulatory requirements that may impact LWB’s business and quality assurance strategies
  • Skills & Experience**:
  • Practice experience in the Human and Community Services sector
  • Understanding of the regulatory and compliance frameworks and standards that are relevant to the Human Services sector
  • Experience providing best practice quality assurance, against established standards
  • Experience working collaboratively and developing rapport with operational areas, working across an organisation to assist in the implementation of organisational change
  • Experience implementing a Quality Management System
  • Experience developing policies, procedures and other process documents, including experience in producing high quality work with an attention to detail
  • Demonstrated ability to function effectively as part of a multi-disciplinary team under significant pressure and meeting hard deadlines
  • Effective time management and organisational skills, well-developed analytical and problem solving skills
    • Successful candidates will be required to clear probity checks including National Criminal History Record Check and Working with Children Check (where relevant to the role).
  • Benefits**:
  • Join one of Australia's largest social purpose organisations
  • Salary packaging and monthly RDO
  • Work with skilled professionals to enhance the lives of the people we support
    • **How to Apply**
    Include your resume and covering letter in one document, click ‘Apply’ and follow the prompts. For any enquiries including persons with disability that require adjustments, contact recruitment@lwb.org.au
    **Applications close at midnight on Thursday 4th October, 2018.**

    Associate

    Industry

    • Business Supplies and Equipment
    • Consumer Services
    • Hospital & Health Care

    Employment Type

    Job Functions

    • Quality Assurance

Company Name EnergyAustralia Company Location Melbourne, AU

Job description

EnergyAustralia is one of Australia's largest Energy companies providing smart, innovative Energy solutions for our customers. We are transforming and are committed to becoming a world-class organisation with the customer at the heart of everything we do.

About The Role

This is a 12-month contract. The purpose of the Learning and Development Lead is to effectively lead the design of innovative and targeted learning and development solutions for strategic projects, through engagement and collaboration with stakeholders and peer groups across the organisation.

Your primary responsibility is ensuring appropriate training activities are planned, designed, developed, delivered and evaluated with appropriate handover to Business as Usual (BAU) training teams.

You will be responsible for;
  • Define the training implementation plan, schedule and associated budget
  • Designing, developing, delivering and evaluating of all project training activities
  • Developing and facilitating of customised training programs and e-learning programs
  • Utilise a Learning Management System (LMS) to record and report on training activities
  • Developing effective assessment and evaluation tools to assess competencies and measure outcomes


What We’re Looking For
  • Demonstrated similar Learning and Development Lead expertise across large scale enterprise wide projects
  • Ideally SAP and/or any enterprise software within Procurement, Finance and HR
  • Certificate IV in Training & Assessment (TAE40110) or equivalent (essential)
  • Experience working with Learning Management Systems (LMS)
  • Demonstrated experience working with e-learning tools such as Articulate &/or Captivate (desirable)
  • Strong experience in identifying training needs, design, development, facilitation and evaluation
  • Outstanding communication and stakeholder engagement skills


How To Apply

If you share our passion for making customers a priority, doing the right thing, leading change and want to be part of an organisation focused on making a positive impact, click the 'Apply" button to submit your application.

For any queries not in this advertisement please contact Tania.Quach@energyaustralia.com.au

Please submit your application online as there is an application form that needs to be completed and please do not email to the email address in this advertisement.

Application will close Friday 9th October 2018.
